She looked at Aracnia with sudden fear and dread. "You mean this 
alien ship is going to come here and try to kill every bot on the 
planet?"  She swallowed real hard.  "And your plan to save our 
metalic butts is to have us join up with Megatron?  Oh no sister. 
Count me out.  If I go back to Megatron, I'm scrap.  If or when that 
ship gets here, I'm scrap.  But if I got a choice, I'd rather take my 
chances with the aliens.  Megatron wants me dead or he wouldn't have 
sent me on a suicide mission in the first place." She looked at 
Quickstrike and sighed. "But if he'll stay with you, then I'll stay," 
she pointed to Quickstrike,"Because I can't leave my big brother 
alone here to die like......like.."she stop and suddenly remembered 
her dream.  She stood there and shook.  Her body was flooded by the 
remembering of her dream when she was returning to life.  It wasn't a 
dream, it was a warming of the future.  "Oh no, no, no, no, "she 
stood there, staring off into nothingness and shook.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, JP3884@a... wrote:
>     Aracnia looked to Quickstrike to answer his question when she 
heard 
> Tarantulas scream. "What is it, whats wrong?"
>     "The Aliens! There...there....there coming here! There sending 
an 
> automated warship called the Armada! Its programmed to destroy any 
> intelligent life, that means us!" He screamed.
>     She felt dread sweep over her body. "Warship? Automated?" She 
stammered.
>     "Yes! Apprently this was a outpost to begin colonization and 
then the 
> beast wars started. Then it became an observation post until an 
earthquake 
> destroyed the bunker and killed the aliens. If anything happned the 
warship 
> would come to obliterate us so they could colonize the planet!" 
Tarantulas 
> screamed.
>     "That means that we have only...."
>     "Only a few days before the Armada arrives and destroys us all! 
I suggest 
> we do something!!!!" He hissed.
>     Aracnia, for the first time in her rulership felt utterly 
incompetent. 
> She turned to Quickstrike, who, for some reason, she felt was the 
only person 
> whou could help her right now.
